channel.description: Recent content in Python on Dang-Khoa's blog

item.title: Log: Using Scipy's Optimization for constrained function
item.description: One thing is worth noting that scipy.optimization.minimize only is able to solve the vector input, instead of multiple dimensional input. Just found an interesting course about probability and simulation [Discrete Choice Methods with Simulation]. To use first-order function operations in Python, use helper functions in functools. It is pretty good. One thing to remember is that we always have to call the methods to evaluate the graph of Theano via eval or the function construction.
